clinical_study.brief_title: Attention Training Technique and Mindful Self-Compassion
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing the Attention Training Technique and Mindful Self-Compassion

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The design of the study is a randomized controlled trial. A total of 80 students with self-reported symptoms of stress/anxiety/depression will be invited to take part in a 3-session course consisting of either attention training or self-compassion/mindfulness based meditation. Attention training involves modifying metacognitive control and enhancing attention flexibility so that people can refrain from responding to intrusions with extended processing. Self-compassion involves not avoiding painful or distressing feelings. Instead these experiences are held in awareness with kindness, understanding, and a sense of shared humanity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of depression as assessed with the Patient Health Questionnaire-9
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after last session, 6 months after intervention
primary_outcome.description: Assesses symptoms of depression. Total score range from 0 (no depression) to 27 (very depressed). Lower values represent better outcome. Subscale scores are not used.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of anxiety as assessed with the Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after last session, 6 months after intervention
primary_outcome.description: Assesses symptoms of anxiety. Total score range from 0 (no depression) to 21 (very depressed). Lower values represent better outcome. Subscale scores are not used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in self-compassion as assessed by the Self-Compassion Scale Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after last session, 6 months after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of self-compassion. Total score range from 12 (no self-compassion) to 60 (high on self-compassion). Higher values represent better outcome. Subscale scores are not used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the attention flexibility subscale of the Detached Mindfulness Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after last session, 6 months after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of attention flexibility. Total score for attention flexibility range from 5 (no flexibility) to 25 (very flexible). Higher values represent better outcome. No other subscales are used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in mindfulness as assessed with The Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after last session, 6 months after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of mindfulness. Total score range from 20 (not mindful at all) to 100(very mindful). Higher values represent better outcome. Subscale scores are not analyzed.

intervention.description: Attention training involves modifying metacognitive control and enhancing attention flexibility so that people can refrain from responding to intrusions with extended processing.
Self-compassion involves not avoiding painful or distressing feelings. Instead these experiences are held in awareness with kindness, understanding, and a sense of shared humanity.
